snippet: Built to meet growing demand for more efficient cars and federal regulations mandating higher fuel economy, the X-cars represented a daring break from Detroit engineering conventions of the time.
abstract: General Motors’ X-body cars, its first front-wheel-drive compact models, were built to meet growing demand for more efficient cars and federal regulations mandating higher fuel economy; cars represented daring break from Detroit engineering conventions, but failed in mid-1980s amid reports of shoddy construction.
lead_paragraph: Built to meet growing demand for more efficient cars and federal regulations mandating higher fuel economy, the X-cars represented a daring break from Detroit engineering conventions of the time.

headline.print_headline: An Early Import Fighter That Only Embarrassed
headline.main: An Early Import Fighter That Only Embarrassed
